page.title: 13TRAFFIC PROBLEM NEWTON ST.C.
page.content: { 50% of the people in our survey mentioned the{heavy traffic on {the main road (A377) as the major {problem in our village.}The difficulty of crossing the road, especially for old people and children,and the danger of accidents was pointed out.Recently {a traffic island near the Post Office, following{years of complaint}by individuals,pressure groups and the Parish Council, has{slightly eased the problem.The road has caused{a death recently in the village.A man pushing his cycle was killed by a passing vehicle. { Articulated lorries and juggernauts cause considerable vibration and noise.Villagers think they travel far {too fast. { A bypass has been considered}in the past,but no money has been set aside or route agreed.
